2008/11/7 James Abley <james.abley@...>:
> JMock when used under JUnit 4.x uses @RunWith, and so does JUnit 4.x
> Parameterized tests. It doesn't look like I can mix the two.

JMock's runner is purely for convenience.  All it does is call
assertIsSatisfied() on the Mockery.  You can use a different runner if
you perform that call explicitly at the end of each test.

--Nat
